headline: Arizona receives ‘F’ grade from Giffords Law Center over gun laws
author: KTAR.COM
sentences: “States with strong gun safety laws have fewer gun deaths — but trafficking leaves residents of these states vulnerable, too,” Robyn Thomas, executive director of the law center, said in a press release.
The Giffords Law Center presented the Grand Canyon State with an ‘F’ grade for 2021, citing the fact that the state continues to have dangerously weak gun laws as a main factor for its grade.
The center tracked and reviewed gun legislation across all 50 states and evaluated bills for their relative strength or weakness before ranking states by letter grade.
The law center is a San Francisco-based nonprofit co-founded by former Arizona congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords and her husband, U.S.
The state’s gun death rate of 16.7 per 100,000 people was above the national average by 22 percent, according to the scorecard.
PHOENIX — A national law center gave Arizona the worst possible grade as part of its nationwide annual gun law scorecard.

Arizona was one of 24 states to receive an ‘F’ grade.
Its missions is to prevent gun violence.
